title: Leonard Bondumier
text:
Leonardo Bondumier (1605–1668) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as <a href="Archbishop%20of%20Split">Archbishop of Split</a> (1641–1668).
Biography.
Leonardo Bondumier was born in <a href="Venice">Venice</a>, <a href="Italy">Italy</a> in 1605.
On 15 April 1641, he was appointed during the papacy of <a href="Pope%20Urban%20VIII">Pope Urban VIII</a> as <a href="Archbishop%20of%20Split">Archbishop of Split</a>.
On 21 April 1641, he was consecrated bishop by <a href="Alessandro%20Cesarini%20%28iuniore%29">Alessandro Cesarini (iuniore)</a>, <a href="Cardinal-Deacon">Cardinal-Deacon</a> of <a href="Sant%27Eustachio">Sant'Eustachio</a>. 
He served as Archbishop of Split until his death in 1668.
